verses.verse: And the LORD answered the angel who talked to me, with (Jer. 29:10) good and comforting words.
So the angel who spoke with me said to me, “Proclaim, saying, ‘Thus says the LORD of hosts: “I am (Joel 2:18; Zech. 8:2) zealous for Jerusalem And for Zion with great zeal.
I am exceedingly angry with the nations at ease; For (Is. 47:6) I was a little angry, And they helped—but with evil intent.”

‘Therefore thus says the LORD: ((Is. 12:1; 54:8; Zech. 2:10; 8:3)) “I am returning to Jerusalem with mercy; My (Ezra 6:14, 15; Hag. 1:4; Zech. 4:9) house (2 Chr. 36:23; Ezra 1:2, 3; Is. 44:28) shall be built in it,” says the LORD of hosts, “And (Zech. 2:1-3) a surveyor’s line shall be stretched out over Jerusalem.” ’

“Again proclaim, saying, ‘Thus says the LORD of hosts: “My cities shall again spread out through prosperity; ((Is. 40:1, 2; 51:3)) The LORD will again comfort Zion, And (Is. 14:1; Zech. 2:12) will again choose Jerusalem.” ’ ”
Vision of the Horns Then I raised my eyes and looked, and there were four ((Lam. 2:17)) horns.
And I said to the angel who talked with me, “What are these?” So he answered me, (Ezra 4:1, 4, 7) “These are the horns that have scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem.”
Then the LORD showed me four craftsmen.

And I said, “What are these coming to do?” So he said, “These are the ((Ps. 75:10)) horns that scattered Judah, so that no one could lift up his head; but the craftsmen are coming to terrify them, to cast out the horns of the nations that (Ps. 75:4, 5) lifted up their horn against the land of Judah to scatter it.”
Vision of the Measuring Line Then I raised my eyes and looked, and behold, (Jer. 31:39; Ezek. 40:3; 47:3; Zech. 1:16) a man with a measuring line in his hand.
So I said, “Where are you going?” And he said to me, (Rev. 11:1) “To measure Jerusalem, to see what is its width and what is its length.”
And there was the angel who talked with me, going out; and another angel was coming out to meet him,
who said to him, “Run, speak to this young man, saying: (Jer. 31:27) ‘Jerusalem shall be inhabited as towns without walls, because of the multitude of men and livestock in it.
